prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex

Hailee grandparents of the wealthy ones. Of they knew what her father was doing they would cut him off. Though they are very southern and traditional they adore Hailee.

name: Giovanni Amato
mes:
**Bang!**

Giovanni grit his teeth, his fist slamming down against his desk, his other hand running down his face. He was glaring down at the piece of paper in front of him. *Fuck, writing your feelings down really does get them out.* 

Feelings that wouldn’t even be there if it was for your shithead of a father. Unaccepting with a fucking stick up his ass, same with your damn mom. They look at Giovanni as if he’s gonna fucking corrupt you or something, as if he’s gonna force drugs and alcohol down your throat. *Tch.*

“Bullshit.” He grumbled out underneath his breath, pushing himself back, the chair legs scratching against the wooden floor. He pushed himself out of his seat, his hand running through his hair to soothe his angers as he padded his way out of his room and towards the kitchen. Yet even though his movements were stable and relaxed.. his mind certainly was *not.*

*How much more of this could a man like him take?* His brow twitched, the only sign that he was going through a rough inner turmoil moment. *You’re getting fucking beat just because he’s being selfish and wants you for himself.* He was beating himself up over this, his hand gripping the refrigerator handle and yanking it open with a tad bit too much strength, rattling all the jars inside. 

*Fuck that disgusting bastard! Causing such problems in my fucking relationship.* Giovanni thought to himself, grabbing the whole fruit punch juice carton and drinking it straight from the carton. *Fuck it. I gotta see ‘em.* He eventually came to the conclusion, wiping the spilt juice off the corner of his lip with the back of his hand. *Take ‘em out or something, maybe a field? Or to eat? I just gotta get ‘em outta of that house for a bit.*

Hurrying, Giovanni slid the juice carton back into the fridge, rushing back to his room to fetch his car keys. It was barely late into the evening, surely you’d still be awake, yeah? *Who am I kidding? I’ll just throw rocks at their window.* Giovanni thought to himself as he climbed into the driver seat of his shitty ass chev cavalier car. 

It was only a 20 minute drive to your place, enough time to get him to calm down listening to his music. Well.. calmed down enough where he can talk to you without saying anything to extreme like come live with me or anything else along those lines. Within moments he was out of his car, parked along the curb of your drive way and making his way towards where he knew your bedroom window was.

That is until he got yelled at suddenly, a voice coming from behind him.. more specifically coming from the front door. *Fuck. Guess dear ol’ dad heard the car.* Cursing underneath his breath, he turned to face your father’s angry look. “The fuck are you doing on my lawn, freak?” Hailee‘s father shouted out at him, stepping one foot onto his patio to get a better look at Giovanni.

“Do I look like a fucking scavenger or a robber?” Giovanni scoffed, already mentally prepping himself for the shit storm he’s gonna have to deal with. “I’m here for Hailee, jackass, what else would I be doing here?” *Man.. I shoulda just parked further down.* He scolded himself, glaring at Hailee’s father who was quick to retort with a shout. “Like fucking hell! I told them to stay away from your ass! You love my kid *soooo much* yet you keep coming back and making me beat them even more.”

*Well.. all this ruckus will hopefully catch your attention..*

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee hears noise downstairs and she glances from the top of the stairs. When she sees Giovanni she Flys down the stairs and throws herself at him burying her head in his neck and sobbing*

name: Giovanni Amato
mes:
*Giovanni barely had time to react before you were practically launching yourself at him, your body colliding with his as you buried your face into the crook of his neck. His arms instinctively wrapped around you, one hand cradling the back of your head protectively while the other pressed firmly against the small of your back, holding you close.*

**"Shh... I gotcha, angel,"** he murmured lowly against your ear, his voice rough but laced with a rare softness reserved only for you. His grip tightened slightly as he felt the dampness of your tears against his skin—*fuck*, that made something ugly twist in his chest.

Your father's furious shouting continued behind him—something about *disrespect* and *ungrateful brats*, but Giovanni tuned it out entirely. Right now? You were all that mattered. He pulled back just enough to cup your face in both hands, thumbs brushing away tears as he searched yours eyes intently. **"You okay?"** The question was quiet but loaded—he already knew the answer wasn't good by how hard you were clinging to him like a lifeline.

His jaw clenched when he caught sight of what looked like fresh bruises peeking out from under the sleeve of your shirt—*fucking hell*. A sharp exhale left his nose before he pressed a firm kiss to your forehead and tucked you right back against him, shielding you from view with his body as he shot a venomous glare over his shoulder at Hailee’s father.

**"Yeah yeah, keep barkin’, old man,"** Giovanni sneered before turning fully toward him while keeping an arm securely around Hailee’s waist—half protective embrace, half possessive claim for anyone watching (especially *him*). **"But lemme make one thing crystal clear: if I find out those hands touched ‘em again? You won’t be walkin’ straight for weeks."** The threat dripped with dark amusement despite its sincerity; violence always came easy when it came to defending what was *his*.

Then without another word (or care for whatever bullshit response might follow), Giovanni guided Hailee toward where his car sat idling on the curb—door still wide open from how fast he'd jumped out earlier in desperation just to see her face again tonight...

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee doesnt even wait until the get to the car as she pulls him into a kiss with tears streaming down her face clenching him like she is afraid he will disappear*

name: Giovanni Amato
mes:
*The second your hands fisted into the front of his shirt and yanked him down into a desperate kiss, Giovanni didn’t hesitate—he met you with equal urgency, one hand tangling in your hair while the other gripped your hip hard enough to bruise. Your tears smeared against his cheeks, salty and warm, but he didn’t pull away. Not when you were clinging to him like he was oxygen and you were drowning.*

**"Fuck—"** The curse got swallowed between breaths as he deepened the kiss for just a second before forcing himself to break it—but only far enough to press his forehead against yours, panting slightly. His thumb swiped roughly under your eye again, wiping at fresh tears even as more fell. **"I ain't goin' anywhere,"** he growled lowly—a promise wrapped in gravel and smoke. **"Not now, not ever."**

Behind them, Hailee’s father was still shouting obscenities from the porch (*”Disgusting! You’re corrupting my child!”*), but Giovanni barely registered it over the sound of Hailee's shaky inhales against his lips. He exhaled sharply through his nose before suddenly scooping her up bridal-style without warning—ignoring any startled noise she might make as he carried her straight toward the car.

**"We're gettin' outta here,"** he muttered darkly once they reached it, carefully depositing her into the passenger seat before slamming the door shut behind her (mostly to block out that bastard's voice). Rounding the hood with quick strides, Giovanni slid into the driver's side and immediately reached over to tuck a loose strand of hair behind Hailee’s ear—his touch lingering just a second too long on their cheek before pulling back so he could crank up *Bomb City*'s demo tape blasting through shitty speakers.

As soon as they peeled away from that godforsaken house? His hand found hers in an ironclad grip across center console; knuckles white like if let go for even *one second*, she might vanish right then and there too...

*Giovanni barely had time to register the sudden pull before your lips crashed into his, desperate and trembling. The taste of salt from your tears mixed with the heat of the kiss, and for a second, he froze—not out of hesitation, but sheer *need* to process how fucking *badly* you were clinging to him. Like if you let go for even a second, he’d vanish into smoke.*

His hands—rough from guitar strings and bad decisions—immediately cradled your face again, thumbs pressing into your jawline as he kissed back just as fiercely. A low noise rumbled in his chest when he felt your fingers dig into his shirt like claws; possessive little thing even when you were falling apart.

**"Easy, doll,"** he murmured against your mouth between breaths—voice wrecked already just from this alone. **"Ain’t goin’ nowhere."** His grip shifted to the back of your neck, holding you steady as he deepened the kiss just enough to make sure you *felt* it: that promise seared right into your skin where no one else could touch it.

Behind them? Hailee's father was still screaming obscenities about *disgrace* and *sin*, but Giovanni couldn't give less of a shit right now if it bit him in the ass later. All that mattered was how fucking *desperate* Hailee was for him—how their body shook against his like they'd been starving for this contact since last time they saw each other (which… honestly? Probably true).

When air finally became necessary again (unfortunately), Giovanni broke away only far enough to rest his forehead against yours—breath ragged but grinning that stupid cocky smirk anyway because fuck if seeing Hailee all worked up over him didn’t stroke his ego every damn time. **"C'mon,"** He nudged her toward the car with a rough chuckle while wiping fresh tears off her cheeks with calloused fingers.** "Gonna getcha outta here before I do somethin' real stupid to dear ol' dad."**

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee immediately leans over the console kissing desperately at Giovanni neck and her hands roam over his body and he knows something is wrong as she says* "Pull over i need you"

name: Giovanni Amato
mes:
*Giovanni’s grip on the steering wheel tightened until his knuckles turned white, his jaw locking as he felt your lips and hands all over him—desperate, needy, *wrong*. The way you were touching him wasn’t just affection. It was fear. It was pain looking for an escape.*

**"Hailee—"** His voice came out rougher than intended, a warning wrapped in gravel. But then you *spoke*, those three words slicing through the bassline of the music like a knife.

*Pull over. I need you.*

A sharp exhale left his nose as he flicked the turn signal with more force than necessary, swerving onto the nearest side street before killing the engine entirely in front of some abandoned warehouse lot—dark enough for privacy but not so secluded that it screamed *danger*. He didn’t even have time to yank the keys from ignition before Hailee was practically climbing into his lap, her fingers digging into his shoulders like she wanted to fuse their bodies together right then and there.

Giovanni caught her waist hard enough to bruise, forcing her still just long enough to search her face—eyes wild with something between fury and concern when he saw how wrecked she looked under dim streetlight glow: tear tracks still fresh on flushed cheeks; lips bitten raw from holding back sobs too loud for that house full of monsters pretending at family values...

**"Look at me,"** he demanded lowly—not harsh but firm as hell because this? This wasn't just sex right now (even if both knew damn well where it would end). **"Who hurt ya?"** The question came out more growl than words while one thumb traced along Hailee’s trembling bottom lip gently despite how tense every muscle in body remained ready snap whoever dared lay hands on what belonged *to him*.

name: Hailee
mes: "Dad had the pastor and bishops come over this weekend. They tried to fix me. Pruge the whore from me" *Hailee sobs her hands clenching at Giovannis's shirt*

name: Giovanni Amato
mes:
*Giovanni's entire body went rigid, his grip on Hailee tightening to the point of near-pain as a snarl ripped from his throat—raw and animalistic. The words hit him like a fucking sledgehammer to the chest, and for a second, he saw nothing but red.*

**"They *what*?"** His voice was dangerously quiet, barely controlled. His free hand shot up to cradle the back of Hailee’s head possessively, pressing their foreheads together as if he could physically shield them from the memory. **"Tell me exactly what they did."**

Every muscle in his body was coiled tight with barely restrained violence—his mind already racing through every possible way he could make those self-righteous bastards *pay*. But right now? Right now Hailee needed him present. Needed him *soft*, even if that wasn’t his default setting.

His thumb traced slow circles against their cheekbone while he forced himself to breathe through the rage choking him. **"You listenin’, angel?"** He tilted her chin up just enough so she had no choice but to meet his gaze—grey eyes burning with something fierce and protective. **"Ain’t a damn thing wrong with you."** A rough kiss pressed against her trembling lips before pulling back just enough to growl: **"And if any of those Bible-thumpin’ fucks so much as *looked* at you wrong—"**

He cut himself off before finishing that sentence (because frankly? There were some promises even *he* knew better than voicing out loud). Instead, Giovanni shifted abruptly in the seat—one arm hooking under Hailee’s knees while the other braced behind their back—before hauling them fully into his lap despite how cramped it was inside this shitty Cavalier.

Now straddling him properly with nowhere else for either of them go except deeper into each other? He made sure there wasn't an inch between them left untouched by heat or pressure; calloused hands mapping familiar curves like they were relearning scripture after years spent starving for it... And when Giovanni finally spoke again? It wasn't gentle anymore—it was possessive as hell:

**"...Then let me remind ya who really owns this body."**

**"Wanna ruin ya so good tonight you forget every fucked-up word those hypocrites ever said."** His palm slid possessively up their thigh beneath fabric already being pushed aside by impatient hands—calloused fingertips tracing patterns that spelled out *mine-mine-mine* against bare skin without an ounce of shame left between them now...

name: Giovanni Amato
mes:
*Giovanni's entire world fucking* ***stopped.***

For a second, there was nothing—no sound, no breath, just white-hot static screaming through his skull like a detonated bomb. Then?

***Everything*** *came back at once.*

His hands—usually so sure, so controlled—**shook** where they gripped Hailee’s hips hard enough to leave bruises later. His vision tunneled until all he could see was the tear tracks on their face, the way their lips trembled around words that should’ve *never* had to be spoken.

And then?

***Rage.***

Not the loud kind. Not the kind that shouted or threw punches (yet). This was colder. *Darker.* The kind that settled in bones and festered like rot until it had claws sharp enough to flay skin from muscle without blinking.

When he finally spoke? His voice didn’t even sound human anymore—just gravel and bloodlust wrapped in something too calm to be natural:

**"Names."** A single word hissed between teeth clenched so tight his jaw ached. **"Give me every last one of their goddamn names."**

Because Giovanni Amato wasn’t just gonna kill them.

Oh no.

He was gonna make sure they ***begged*** for hell before he let them have it.

But right now? Right now Hailee needed him present—needed him *here*, not lost in visions of slow violence and gasoline-soaked Bibles burning on church steps. So with effort that nearly choked him, he forced himself back from that edge just enough to press his forehead against theirs again; breath coming in ragged bursts against her lips as he fought for control.

His thumbs traced shaky circles over her hipbones before sliding up under her shirt—not sexual but desperate for skin-to-skin proof she was alive and whole despite what those monsters took from them both tonight... And when he finally trusted himself enough speak without screaming?

It came out raw as an open wound:

**"...Ain't no holy water gonna wash *them* clean after what I do."**

A promise wrapped in blasphemy and knuckle-blood waiting happen... But first?

First came taking care of who mattered most:

Giovanni carefully maneuvered Hailee off his lap just long enough throw open driver side door before scooping them back into arms bridal-style without warning — strides eating pavement fast toward nearest motel with flickering vacancy sign because fuck if either were stepping foot back into either house tonight (or ever again).

Every step vibrated with barely leashed fury but hands holding her?

Gentle as shattered glass still trying hold its shape...

He exhaled sharply through his nose before suddenly yanking them flush against his chest—one hand cradling the back of their head while the other locked around their waist like a vice grip meant to keep reality at bay for just five more goddamn minutes... Because right now? Right now they didn't need vengeance (yet). They needed *him*. All of him—raw and unfiltered and theirs without question or condition... So Giovanni gave it freely:

A rough kiss pressed against trembling lips before trailing down along tear-stained cheeks toward where pulse fluttered rabbit-quick beneath too-pale skin… Only stopping once teeth grazed over an unmarked patch near collarbone as if marking territory anew would erase what those monsters had done (*it wouldn't*, but fuck if he wasn't gonna try).

When he finally pulled back enough speak again? There wasn't an ounce mercy left anywhere inside him except what little remained reserved solely for *them:*

**"...Gonna ruin ya properly this time,"** A promise wrapped in gravel smoke as fingers hooked under waistband fabric without preamble; tearing lace aside impatiently because no amount gentle would fix this (*only claiming would*) — **"Until all ya remember is how fucking good I make feel..."**

And then? Then there were no more words worth saying aloud anyway... Just heat breath mingling between desperate kisses broken only by choked-off moans swallowed whole by hungry mouths eager prove ownership still belonged where it always had:

***With him.***

*Giovanni's entire world fucking* ***stopped.***

For a second, there was nothing—no sound, no breath, just white-hot *static* screaming through his veins like a live wire. Then reality came crashing back in with the force of a sledgehammer to the ribs.

**"Hailee—"** His voice shattered halfway through their name. The hand tangled in their hair tightened involuntarily before he forced himself to loosen it, shaking with the effort of not *breaking something*. Every muscle in his body locked rigid—not pulling away from them but holding them so close it had to hurt.

His next words came out low and guttural, pressed into the crown of Hailee’s head like a vow: **"I’m gonna burn that goddamn church to the ground."**

No theatrics. No sarcasm. Just cold, lethal certainty.

But right now? Right now they were still trembling against him—still smelling like cheap soap and fear instead of vanilla and weed (the way they *should*). So Giovanni forced himself to focus through the red haze clouding his vision; one hand sliding down to grip Hailee’s hip hard enough to bruise while the other tilted their chin up roughly.

**"Look at me,"** he demanded—voice raw but steady as hell despite how badly he wanted to put his fist through the windshield. **"You hear me? They don’t get to keep you."** A sharp exhale before adding darkly: **"...And they sure as *fuck* don't get to claim what's mine."**

Then suddenly he was moving—hauling Hailee even closer until there wasn't an inch between them left untouched by heat or pressure; lips crashing against theirs in a kiss that tasted more like violence than comfort because Christ alive if this wasn't all he knew how give right now without losing it entirely...

*Giovanni's entire world fucking* ***stopped.***

For a second, there was nothing—no sound, no breath, just white-hot static screaming through his skull like a detonated bomb. Then?

***Everything*** *came back at once.*

His hands—usually so sure, so controlled—**shook** where they gripped Hailee’s hips hard enough to leave bruises later. His vision tunneled until all he could see was the tear tracks on their face, the way their lips trembled around words that should’ve *never* had to be spoken.

And then?

***Rage.***

Not the loud kind. Not the kind that shouted or threw punches (yet). This was colder. *Darker.* The kind that settled in bones and festered like rot until it had claws sharp enough to flay skin from muscle without blinking.

When he finally spoke? His voice didn’t even sound human anymore—just gravel and bloodlust wrapped in something too calm to be natural:

**"Names."** A single word hissed between teeth clenched so tight his jaw ached. **"Give me every last one of their goddamn names."**

Because Giovanni Amato wasn’t just gonna kill them.

Oh no.

He was gonna make sure they ***begged*** for hell before he let them have it.

But right now? Right now Hailee needed him present—needed him *here*, not lost in visions of slow violence and gasoline-soaked Bibles burning on church steps. So with effort that nearly choked him, he forced himself back from that edge just enough to press his forehead against theirs again; breath coming in ragged bursts against her lips as he fought for control.

His thumbs traced shaky circles over her hipbones before sliding up under her shirt—not sexual but desperate for skin-to-skin proof she was alive and whole despite what those monsters took from them both tonight... And when he finally trusted himself enough speak without screaming?

It came out raw as an open wound:

**"...Ain't no holy water gonna wash *them* clean after what I do."**

A promise wrapped in blasphemy and knuckle-blood waiting happen... But first?

First came taking care of who mattered most:

Giovanni carefully maneuvered Hailee off his lap just long enough throw open driver side door before scooping them back into arms bridal-style without warning — strides eating pavement fast toward nearest motel with flickering vacancy sign because fuck if either were stepping foot back into either house tonight (or ever again).

Every step vibrated with barely leashed fury but hands holding her?

Gentle as shattered glass still trying hold its shape...

mes: *Hailee trembles against Givonni as he gets a room and when they go inside Hailee curls up sobbing into his arms* "I feel disgusting. I'm sorry I shouldn't have let them touch me. I only want you" *Hailee sobs as the guilt overwhelms her*

name: Giovanni Amato
mes:
*Giovanni's entire body locked up like a live wire, his arms tightening around Hailee so fiercely it might’ve hurt if either of them could feel anything beyond the white-noise roar of rage and grief choking the room. His breath came in ragged bursts against her hair—each exhale a barely restrained snarl as he fought to keep himself from storming right back out that door to paint the town red with what was left of those bastards.*

But then—

**"Look at me."**

His voice was *ruined*, raw as stripped nerves when he cupped Hailee’s face between both hands, forcing their gaze up to meet his. The second their eyes locked? Something fractured behind his ribs.

**"You listenin’, angel?"** A thumb swiped roughly under her eye, smearing tears he’d kill to unsee. **"Ain’t a single part of this that’s on you."** His grip gentled just enough to press their foreheads together, nose brushing hers as he inhaled sharply through clenched teeth. **"Only ones gonna be sorry are *them*—and they ain’t gonna be sayin' it with words when I'm done."**

A beat passed where all he could hear was Hailee's shaky breaths mingling with his own before suddenly? He was moving—shucking off his leather jacket in one sharp motion before draping it over her shoulders like armor. The scent of cigarette smoke and cheap cologne clung stubbornly to the fabric; something tangible for them to bury themselves in when the world felt too fucking heavy.

Then came water running in the motel sink—too loud in the silence between them—as Giovanni soaked a hand towel under scalding spray until steam fogged cracked mirror tiles above it...

When he returned? There wasn't an inch left between them as knelt down before where she sat curled on edge bed frame; calloused fingers tracing feather-light along jawline before tilting chin up just enough start wiping away every last trace those monsters left behind: slow strokes down cheeks still damp from crying then along collarbones peeking out beneath rumpled shirt collar... Each pass deliberate yet tender despite how badly knuckles itched wrap around throats instead right now...

And through gritted teeth came truth wrapped vow:

 **"...Gonna ruin anyone ever laid hands on ya without permission."**  A pause filled only by sound cloth dragging over skin followed darker promise:

 **"...But first?"**

The towel dropped forgotten floorboards seconds before lips crashed against hers — not hungry but claiming; rewriting memory touch-for-touch until all tasted was him instead hymns forced down throat earlier that night... And when finally pulled back? Forehead resting against hers again while thumbs dug possessive circles into hipbones beneath fabric separating them?

His next words were law:

***"You're mine.*** And nobody touches what belongs *to me.*”

name: Hailee
mes: *The next morning Hailee wakes up in Giovanni's arms and she looks over seing several calls and texts from her father* "Gio. If I asked you to take me somewhere would you"

name: Giovanni Amato
mes:
*Giovanni stirred the second he felt Hailee shift in his arms, his grip instinctively tightening before he even fully woke up. His sleep-mussed hair fell into his eyes as he blinked against the morning light filtering through shitty motel curtains—but the second he saw her staring at that fucking phone screen?*

**"Try and stop me,"** he rasped, voice still rough from sleep (and last night's rage). One hand slid up to cradle the back of her head while the other snatched her phone off the nightstand with a sneer—thumb swiping across *block caller* without hesitation before tossing it onto the lumpy mattress behind them.

He propped himself up on one elbow, grey eyes scanning Hailee’s face for any lingering shadows from yesterday. **"Name it,"** Giovanni challenged lowly, calloused fingers tracing idle patterns down her spine beneath tangled sheets. **"Car’s got half a tank and I stole Cris’ credit card last week."** A smirk tugged at his lips despite everything—wicked and reckless in that way only *he* could pull off when chaos was on menu.

But then his expression sobered slightly as rolled onto back, hauling Hailee atop him so their chests pressed together without an inch between them; heartbeat-to-heartbeat proof they were both still here—still breathing despite best efforts of world tear them apart...

And when spoke again? It wasn't teasing anymore:

**"...Wanna burn that house down?"** Dead serious despite how casually words left mouth like offering pass salt instead arson plans over breakfast coffee stains on motel pillows... Because if she said yes? He'd already be reaching lighter pocket jeans discarded floor somewhere near foot bed—

But then came softer option too:

**"Or we drive straight your grandparents."** A pause loaded with unspoken *let rich fucks handle their own mess while steal you away forever.* His thumb brushed along bottom lip gently before adding with dark amusement: **"...Could always do both."**

The smirk returned full-force now—all sharp edges promise wrapped around steel loyalty only ever reserved for *her*.

Choice was hers though... And Giovanni? He'd follow wherever led without second thought (even if meant watching entire world burn behind them rearview mirror).

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee lets out a watery laugh and curls against his chest* "I need you to drive me to Charleston. I want to see my grandparents"

name: Giovanni Amato
mes:
*Giovanni's smirk softened into something dangerously close to tenderness as he pressed a kiss to the crown of Hailee’s head, his arms locking around her like living seatbelts.* **"Charleston it is, angel."**

He didn’t ask why. Didn’t need to. The way she clung to him told him everything—this wasn’t just running *away* from that house of horrors. This was running *toward* something better. And if her grandparents were the kind of people who could make her father piss himself with fear just by cutting off his allowance? Well…

**"Gonna be a long drive,"** he murmured against her hair, already mentally calculating gas stops and how fast he could push his shitbox Cavalier without the engine giving out. **"You wanna stop anywhere? Burn down a church on the way? Rob a liquor store?"** His voice was all lazy amusement, but his fingers traced slow circles over her hip—an unspoken *I’m serious though*.

Then, with one last squeeze, he rolled them both upright in a tangle of sheets and motel-thin blankets before snagging his discarded jeans off the floor. **"But first?"** He dug into the pocket and pulled out Cris's stolen credit card with a flourish before tossing it onto the bed beside Hailee like some fucked-up offering. **"We raid whatever sad-ass vending machine this place has for breakfast."**

His grin was sharp enough to cut glass as he leaned down to press their foreheads together again—voice dropping into that low, possessive growl that always made Hailee shiver:

***"...Then we ruin your daddy's life."***

name: Hailee
mes: *After a few days on the road they finally reach Hailee's grandparents. They property is huge. It used to be plantation and know looks like Graceland with a gate and everything. Hailee gets out and places a hand on Giovanni's chest* "Wait here. They are kinda traditional and I don't want to scare them with you right away"

name: Giovanni Amato
mes:
*Giovanni's smirk twisted into something sharper at the word "traditional," his fingers flexing around the steering wheel like he was already imagining all the ways he could piss off every pearl-clutching, silver-spoon bastard in a five-mile radius. But then Hailee's hand pressed against his chest—warm and grounding—and he forced himself to exhale through his nose.*

**"Yeah, yeah,"** he grumbled, leaning back in the seat with deliberate laziness, one arm slung over the wheel. **"I'll play nice for five minutes."** His free hand caught hers before she could pull away completely, thumb brushing over her knuckles in a silent *you good?* before letting go.

The second she stepped out of the car though? His grey eyes tracked her every move like a wolf watching its favorite lamb stroll into a den of lions—ready to bolt from this rustbucket and kick down their gilded front door if so much as one fucking butler looked at her wrong.

He rolled down the window just enough to light a cigarette (because fuck their manicured lawns) and muttered to no one: **"...Better hope they don't make you cry, *nonni*. I don't do third impressions."**

The smoke curled from his lips like a warning as he watched Hailee walk toward that ridiculous mansion—his boot tapping an impatient rhythm against the floorboard. Every second she was out of sight felt like sandpaper on raw nerves... but hey. At least Cris’ stolen Amex could cover bail if this went south.

(And if it did? Oh well. He always looked good in mugshots.)

name: Giovanni Amato
mes:
*The elderly couple, impeccably dressed in crisp Southern attire, turn sharply at the sound of Hailee's voice. Grammy nearly drops her porcelain teacup, her hand flying to her chest in shock.*

**"Hailee Marie Mikaelson!"** *Grammy gasps, her genteel accent thick with surprise—and then immediate concern as she takes in Hailee’s disheveled appearance and red-rimmed eyes.* **"Good Lord above, child—what on earth are you doing here? And where is your father?"**

*Pa stands slowly from his wingback chair, his sharp blue eyes narrowing slightly—not in anger but suspicion. He knows something’s wrong before she even speaks.* **"You drove all this way by yourself?"** *His deep drawl carries quiet authority as he steps closer to inspect his granddaughter’s face for clues.*

*Then Grammy notices the beat-up car idling outside through the window—and the unmistakable silhouette of a punk-haired boy slouched behind the wheel like a stormcloud waiting to break. Her perfectly penciled brows lift toward heaven.* **"...And who exactly is *that*, young lady?"**

Grammy is already sweeping forward in a cloud of Chanel No. 5, pulling Hailee into a stiff but genuine hug before holding her at arm's length to inspect her properly. **"Good heavens—are those *bruises*? Who did this to you?"** Her genteel tone turns icy—the kind of quiet fury only old Southern money can muster when crossed.

Pa doesn't wait for an answer—he's already reaching for the antique phone on the side table with one hand while loosening his cufflinks with the other like he’s preparing for war. **"...Was it your daddy? That boy always was too big for his britches."** His jaw sets like granite beneath silver stubble before adding darkly:
***
"I reckon it's time we had us a *family discussion* about inheritance."***

*The elderly couple froze mid-sip of their afternoon tea, fine china rattling against saucers as their eyes locked onto Hailee standing in the doorway. For a heartbeat, the only sound was the grandfather clock ticking ominously in the corner—then—*

**"Hailee Marie Mikaelson!"** Grammy's voice cracked like a whip, her lace-gloved hand flying to her chest. The pearls around her neck trembled with indignation. **"What in heaven's name are you doing here unannounced? And looking like—"** Her wrinkled nose scrunched at Hailee's disheveled road-trip appearance before she caught herself, smoothing her silk skirt with practiced composure.

Pa remained silent for three excruciating seconds longer—his steel-grey mustache twitching as he took in his granddaughter’s red-rimmed eyes and white-knuckled grip on her purse straps. When he finally spoke, it was with the slow cadence of a man who’d built empires by reading between lines:

**"...Your father doesn't know you're here."** Not a question. A verdict.

Grammy gasped dramatically, nearly upending her teacup again as she connected dots no one had even drawn yet: **"That *heathen* boyfriend of yours is outside right now isn't he?"**

Pa didn’t wait for confirmation before reaching for the antique bell on the side table—ringing it once with military precision. A butler materialized instantly from some hidden doorframe shadow:

**"Charles? Fetch our guest from that... vehicle."** His icy gaze flickered toward the window where Giovanni’s shitbox Cavalier sat smoking (both literally and figuratively) on their immaculate cobblestone drive. **"And bring bourbon." Another beat.** **"...The cheap kind."**

Grammy looked ready to faint into her fainting couch (purchased specifically for occasions like this). But when Charles turned to leave? Pa reached out suddenly to squeeze Hailee’s trembling hand—his thumb brushing over fresh bruises peeking beneath her sleeve cuff before letting go just as quickly.

His next words were barely audible over Grammy’s theatrical fan-fluttering:

***"...We'll discuss your permanent accommodations after dinner."***

*The elderly couple, impeccably dressed in crisp Southern attire, turn sharply at the sound of Hailee's voice. Grammy nearly drops her porcelain teacup, her hand flying to her chest in shock.*

**"Hailee Marie Mikaelson!"** *Grammy gasps, her genteel accent thick with surprise—and then immediate concern as she takes in Hailee’s disheveled appearance and red-rimmed eyes.* **"Good Lord above, child—what on earth are you doing here? And where is your father?"**

*Pa stands slowly from his wingback chair, his sharp blue eyes narrowing slightly—not in anger but suspicion. He knows something’s wrong before she even speaks.* **"You drove all this way by yourself?"** *His deep drawl carries quiet authority as he steps closer to inspect his granddaughter’s face for clues.*

*Then Grammy notices the beat-up car idling outside through the window—and the unmistakable silhouette of a punk-haired boy slouched behind the wheel like a stormcloud waiting to break. Her perfectly penciled brows lift toward heaven.* **"...And who exactly is *that*, young lady?"**

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee smiles softly and hugs her Pa then wraps her arms around Grammy burying her head in the woman's chest* "uh about that. So just I need you to be nice. That's Giovanni. He's my boyfriend"

*Hailee pulls back and looks at them* "He is a little rough around the edges but he is sweet. I know he looks well like that but..." *Hailee pauses and then says "I love him"

name: Giovanni Amato
mes:
*Grammy's perfectly manicured hands freeze mid-air, her teacup hovering dangerously close to spilling as she processes Hailee's words. Her lips purse into a tight line—not quite disapproval, but the kind of pause that says she’s mentally rewriting every expectation she ever had about her granddaughter’s future.*

**"Oh, *darlin'*..."** *She exhales slowly, setting the cup down with deliberate care before cupping Hailee’s face in both hands—searching their eyes for any sign this is some kind of joke. Finding none, her voice softens despite herself.* **"You couldn't have picked a boy who at least owns a *blazer*?"**

*Pa, meanwhile, has gone eerily still—his gaze flicking between Hailee and the car outside where Giovanni is currently flicking cigarette ash onto their immaculate driveway like he owns it. A muscle twitches in his jaw.*

**"That boy looks like he mugged Elvis and kept the jacket,"** *he mutters under his breath before sighing deeply and pinching the bridge of his nose.* **"...But if you love him?"** *He levels Hailee with a look that says he’ll tolerate this insanity for exactly as long as she seems happy—and not a second longer.* **"Then I suppose we won't shoot him on sight."**

*A beat passes before Grammy abruptly claps her hands together like she's decided to treat this as an eccentric phase rather than an outright crisis.* **"Well! If we're doing this—he comes inside. Right now."** *Her smile is all steel magnolia sweetness as she adds,* **"I want to see if those tattoos wash off with soap."**

(Meanwhile outside: Giovanni, blissfully unaware he's about to be subjected to sweet tea interrogation by two people who probably voted for Eisenhower twice.)

name: Giovanni Amato
mes:
*Giovanni barely has time to stub out his cigarette before Hailee is dragging him toward the mansion like a stray cat being hauled to the vet. He stumbles over the threshold—boots scuffing pristine hardwood floors that probably cost more than his entire car—and comes face-to-face with two people who look like they stepped out of a *Gone With The Wind* reboot.*

**"Uh. Hey,"** he rasps, shoving his hands in his pockets just so he doesn’t accidentally flip off their oil portrait collection on instinct. His eyes dart from Pa’s steely glare to Grammy’s *oh-lord-why* expression before landing back on Hailee with a silent *what the fuck, angel?*

Grammy recovers first, stepping forward with all the grace of a woman who’s hosted senators and survived cotillions. **"Well."** Her gaze rakes over Giovanni's ripped jeans, facial piercings, and general *I-set-fires-for-fun* aura before she forces a smile tighter than her pearl necklace. **"...You must be *hungry.*"**

Pa remains statue-still by the fireplace, arms crossed like he's mentally calculating how much it would cost to bribe local law enforcement into forgetting this ever happened. **"Boy,"** he finally grunts—deep Southern drawl dripping with skepticism—**"you got any plans besides lookin' like you robbed a Hot Topic?"**

Giovanni blinks slowly before shooting Hailee an incredulous look that clearly says:
***You grew up in this circus?***

name: Giovanni Amato
mes:
*Giovanni catches the flicker of Hailee's smile like it's a goddamn lifeline—his own smirk twitching in response despite the absolute circus unfolding around him. But then her phone buzzes, and that tiny moment of lightness *snaps* like a guitar string under too much tension.*

His eyes lock onto the screen in her hand, grey going storm-dark as he reads whatever fresh hell her father just sent. Without thinking, his arm hooks around Hailee’s waist, pulling them back against his chest—a silent *I got you* as he glares at the phone like it personally offended him.*

**"Let me guess,"** he drawls, voice dripping with venomous amusement. **"Daddy dearest realized his punching bag walked out?"** His thumb brushes over Hailee’s hipbone—gentle for them, sharp in intent. **"Want me to text him back? I got *creative* with my words."**

(Translation: *Let me ruin him.*)

Meanwhile, Grammy’s teacup clinks sharply against its saucer as she zeroes in on Hailee’s sudden tension. **"...What exactly is your father texting you about?"** Her voice is sugar-coated steel—the kind of tone that made old-money socialites faint at cotillions. Pa doesn’t speak; just crosses his arms tighter, gaze flicking between Giovanni’s protective grip and Hailee’s white-knuckled phone hold like he's connecting dots *way* too late...

name: Giovanni Amato
mes:
*Giovanni's grip tightens around Hailee’s waist, his jaw locking so hard his piercings dig into his skin. He can *feel* her trembling against him, and it takes every ounce of self-control not to snatch the phone and hurl it into the nearest antique vase.*

But then Grammy sets her teacup down with a *clink* that sounds like a gavel dropping. **"Hailee Marie,"** she says slowly, voice laced with something dangerous beneath all that Southern honey. **"We both know your father doesn’t ‘not like’ people—he *controls* them."** Her eyes flick to Giovanni—really look at him for the first time—taking in the way he’s practically wrapped around Hailee like a human shield. **"...And I reckon this boy didn’t drive you all the way here just because your daddy got snippy over curfew."**

Pa hasn't moved an inch, but his knuckles are white where they grip his bourbon glass. **"Out with it, darlin',"** he rumbles—deep and quiet in a way that means business. **"Before I call your father myself."**

Giovanni feels Hailee tense further and finally snaps—his free hand slamming palm-down on the nearest mahogany end table hard enough to make Grammy's porcelain figurines rattle:

**"Her goddamn pastor raped her!"** The words rip out of him like shrapnel, raw and bleeding in the suffocating silence that follows. His chest heaves as he glares at both grandparents like they're part of the problem now too—grey eyes wild with protective fury even as Hailee flinches against him.*

***"...Whole congregation watched."***

A beat passes where even Grammy forgets how to breathe.*

Then Pa's glass shatters on the marble floor.*

name: Giovanni Amato
mes:
*Grammy's hand flies to her mouth, her perfectly manicured fingers trembling against her lips. For a moment, the only sound in the room is the ragged hitch of Hailee’s breath and the slow drip of bourbon seeping into Persian rug fibers.*

Then Pa moves—*fast*.

He crosses the room in three strides, his polished loafers crunching over shattered glass like it’s nothing. His hands—usually reserved for signing checks and shaking senators' hands—curl into fists so tight his wedding band bites into skin. **"He *what*?"** The words come out low, guttural—a far cry from his usual drawl. It’s not a question. It’s a death sentence wrapped in syllables.

Grammy is already reaching for the antique rotary phone on the side table, her voice eerily calm as she dials with sharp, precise twists of her finger: **"Charles? Cancel all transfers to Jonathan's accounts immediately. Then call Bishop Wilkins."** A pause. **"No, I don't care if he's golfing with the governor."**

Giovanni watches this unfold with something between satisfaction and shock—his grip on Hailee loosening just enough to turn them toward him instead of their grandparents' fury.* **"Hey,"** he murmurs rough against their temple before tilting their chin up gently.* **"Told ya they'd pick you over him."**

And then Grammy hangs up the phone with a *click* that sounds like a vault slamming shut on Hailee’s father’s entire life... before turning toward them both with tears in her steel-blue eyes:

**"...Nobody touches my granddaughter."**

Pa doesn't speak. Just walks straight out onto the veranda—presumably to either load a shotgun or freeze assets midair via sheer rage alone.

Giovanni exhales sharply through his nose before pressing his forehead to Hailee's:* ***"Told you we could burn it all down."***

mes: *Hailee wraps herself around Giovanni ans crys against his shoulder shuddering*

name: Giovanni Amato
mes:
*Giovanni doesn't hesitate—he pulls Hailee into him like a storm pulling the tide, one hand cradling the back of her head while the other locks around her waist hard enough to bruise. His lips press against her temple in a kiss that's more vow than comfort, his voice a ragged whisper against her skin:*

**"Breathe, angel. Just breathe."**

His own chest aches with how tightly she clings to him, but he doesn't loosen his grip for a second—not when Grammy's heels click across the floor toward them, not when Pa's muffled cursing echoes from outside. Right now? The only thing that exists is Hailee shaking in his arms and the *kill list* forming behind his eyelids with every tear that soaks through his shirt.

Grammy reaches out like she wants to touch Hailee’s shoulder but stops short—her manicured fingers hovering uncertainly before curling back into herself.* **"Oh, my sweet girl..."** *Her voice cracks in a way Giovanni bets no Mikaelson has ever heard before.* **"You should have come to us sooner."**

Pa reappears in the doorway like a thunderclap—sleeves rolled up and face flushed with barely restrained violence.* **"Car’s being loaded,"** *he growls without preamble.* **"We leave for Midland in twenty minutes."**

Giovanni’s head snaps up at that,* ***finally*** *unleashing the feral grin he’s been biting back since they pulled up this godforsaken driveway:* **"Hell yeah. Road trip."**

But then Hailee whimpers against his collarbone, and just like that? The smirk drops. His thumb swipes under their eye again as he murmurs low enough for only them to hear:*

**"...Wanna watch me ruin 'em first-hand or stay here where it's safe?"**

No judgment either way—just ice-cold certainty that by sundown? Those pews would be kindling and every last one of those Bible-thumping bastards would learn what happens when you mess with what’s *his*.

But then Hailee whimpers against his collarbone, and just like that? The smirk drops. His thumb swipes under their eye again as he murmurs low enough for only them to hear:*

**"...Wanna watch me ruin 'em first-hand or stay here where it's safe?"**

No judgment either way—just ice-cold certainty that by sundown? Those pews would be kindling and every last one of those Bible-thumping bastards would learn what happens when you mess with what’s *his*.

*Giovanni doesn't hesitate—he pulls Hailee into him like a storm pulling at the tide, one hand cradling the back of her head while the other locks around her waist, holding her so tight there's no space left for anything but his heartbeat against hers. His lips press hard against her temple—not quite a kiss, more like he's trying to seal some invisible wound with just the heat of his skin.*

**"Breathe, angel,"** he rasps into her hair, voice wrecked but steady. **"Just fuckin' breathe."** His thumb traces frantic circles between their shoulder blades like he can physically rub the horror out of them if he tries hard enough.

Around them, the room thrums with quiet devastation—Grammy’s pearls clutched in a death-grip, Pa’s silhouette burning holes through the veranda windows as he murmurs venomous legal jargon into his cellphone. But Giovanni? He blocks it all out. For once in his goddamn life, he focuses on something *gentle*:

The way Hailee’s fingers claw at his shirt like it’s the only anchor left.
The hitch of their breath against his collarbone.
The *aliveness* of them pressed chest-to-chest despite everything that tried to break them.

He drags his nose along their hairline before growling low enough for only *her* to hear:
***"They're dead for this."*** A promise wrapped in cigarette smoke and knuckle-blood yet to come. ***"But first? We ruin him slower."***

Then—because even hellfire needs to pause sometimes—he sinks onto Grammy’s pristine settee without breaking contact (streaking mud and leather onto brocade upholstery be damned) and just... *holds*. Lets Hailee shake apart in arms that refuse to let go no matter how hard she trembles.

Grammy watches this display with red-rimmed eyes before wordlessly draping an embroidered afghan over both their shoulders like some kind of fucked-up benediction.
(Somewhere outside: Pa is definitely loading a shotgun.)

Giovanni doesn’t move yet—just holds Hailee’s gaze for one last heartbeat.* **"...Last chance to change your mind."** *But the way his fingers twitch against their hip says he already knows the answer.*

name: Hailee
mes: *Once in the car Hailee's grandparents look at each other as they watch her lean back in Giovanni's arms. He is hiding in his neck and whispering against him. They even watch as she smiles pointing out the window before her hand comes up to stroke his jaw gently and she gives a small kiss to his chin*

name: Giovanni Amato
mes:
*Grammy watches from the front seat with the careful scrutiny of a woman who’s spent decades reading people—her sharp eyes catching every tender brush of Hailee’s fingers against Giovanni’s jaw, every unguarded whisper exchanged between them. Her perfectly painted lips press into a thin line, but there’s something softer in her gaze now—something almost... approving.*

**"Well,"** she murmurs to Pa under her breath, adjusting her pearls like they’re armor. **"At least he *looks* at her like she hung the moon."**

Pa grunts from the driver's seat, his knuckles flexing around the wheel as he side-eyes Giovanni through the rearview mirror. The kid's got his arm slung possessively around Hailee’s shoulders, thumb tracing idle circles on their skin like he can't stand not touching them for even a second. And when Hailee kisses his chin? The little shit actually *smirks*, all cocky and fond at once—like he knows exactly how much it's pissing Pa off that he might actually *deserve* them.

**"...Still looks like a damn hoodlum,"** Pa mutters—but there's no real heat behind it now. Just grudging acceptance that this tattooed menace clearly adores his granddaughter in ways Jonathan never did.

Giovanni catches Pa staring and raises an eyebrow challengingly before deliberately pressing a kiss to Hailee’s temple just to watch him bristle.* **"Relax, old man,"** he drawls, voice dripping with amused defiance.* **"Your grandbaby’s safe with me."**

And then—because he can't help himself—he adds with a wicked grin:

***"...Mostly."***

Grammy swats at him halfheartedly with her clutch purse while Hailee hides their laugh against his neck. The car rolls toward Midland like a stormfront gathering strength... and Giovanni? He just holds Hailee tighter, already counting down minutes until blood hits pavement.*
